column1: [Charania] 76ers’ players currently listed questionable for Saturday vs. Denver due to health and safety protocols: Joel Embiid, Tobias Harris, Danny Green, Shake Milton, Matisse Thybulle, Vincent Poirier, Paul Reed
[Hollinger] Philly only had 8 players today, but between Isaiah Joe, Paul Reed, Tony Bradley, Mike Scott and Dwight Howard, they had 13 first names.

[Wojnarowski] The Sixers are expected to have nine eligible players today, including three cleared from protocol: Joel Embiid, Danny Green and Paul Reed, sources tell ESPN.

Philly only had 8 players today, but between Isaiah Joe, Paul Reed, Tony Bradley, Mike Scott and Dwight Howard, they had 13 first names.
Sixers are currently playing four rookies at the same time with Dwigth Howard at Center: Tyrese Maxey, Dakota Mathias, Isaiah Joe, and Paul Reed
[Wojnarowski] The Sixers are expected to have nine eligible players today, including three cleared from protocol: Joel Embiid, Danny Green and Paul Reed, sources tell ESPN.
[Highlight] Danny Green with an interesting... celebration as the rookie Paul Reed gets his first NBA basket
Sixers Two-Way Rookie Paul Reed says Joel Embiid inspired him to get stronger because he didn’t wanna be one of those guys that’s “barbecue chicken” vid from @JGrasso_

[Bontemps] The Sixers signed Paul Reed, the No. 58 pick in the 2020 NBA Draft, to a three-year deal over the weekend, with the final two years non-guaranteed, sources told ESPN. Reed, who was the MVP of the G League Bubble in Orlando, got double his salary for the rest of this season.

Dwight Howard on 76ers teammate Paul Reed: “The crazy part about Paul and I is he went to my basketball camp when I was in Orlando as a kid,” Howard smiled. “For him to be my teammate is … I feel like I’m like ancient.”
[Highlight] Paul “Bball Paul” Reed picks up the nice block, gets down the floor and eurosteps into the slam, and Embiid loves it so much he rolls on the floor

[Grimm]: The very long Sixers/Thunder injury report: Ben Simmons, Joel Embiid, Tobias Harris, Furkan Korkmaz, Danny Green, and Paul Reed are listed as questionable for tonight’s game. | Tony Bradley is questionable for OKC. Gabriel Deck, Lu Dort, SGA, Josh Hall, and Muscala are out.
Paul “BBall Paul” Reed in just 10 minutes tonight: 10/9/1 with 1 steal and 2 blocks shooting 5/7 from the field
[Highlight] Paul "Bball Paul" Reed with the block and pretty euro step for the slam on the other end!
[Highlight] Paul “Bball Paul” Reed rejects Moses Brown and gets rewarded with the slam at the other end
[Highlight] Paul “Bball Paul” Reed flies in for the reverse putback slam and Embiid loves it!

[Neubeck] Paul Reed reflecting on having a rookie season as part of the No. 1 team in the East, where he was both the G League MVP and an end of bench guy. “I know I’m good and stuff, but still stay humble…you know, trust the process, TTP.”
[Highlight] Maxey and Paul Reed connect on the Alley

[Neubeck] Paul Reed mentions several things he wants to get better at this summer, from passing to shooting to finishing around the basket. And also, “Moving guys out the way with these new muscles I’m finna have”

[NBA Communications] All-Summer League First Team: Jalen Johnson, Davion Mitchell, Trey Murphy III, Payton Pritchard, Jalen Smith, Cam Thomas, Obi Toppin; All-Summer League Second Team: Cade Cunningham, Luka Garza, Jalen Green, Paul Reed, Patrick Williams
76ers Paul Reed tonight - 27-20-4-4-4 on 11/17 shooting
Paul Reed close to a 5/5/5/5/5 game with a statline of 27/20/4/4/4
[Highlight] Rayjon Tucker miraculously heals to dunk the lob from Paul Reed
Paul Reed tonight: 27 points in 65/67/100 shooting splits, 20 rebounds, 4 assists, 4 steals, 4 blocks

[Rosen] Danny Green says Paul Reed was one of the first to reach out he re-signed: "[Paul] was like, ‘Did you write the wedding vows?’ He asked if I was going to come to Summer League. I said, ‘I’m going to try if I can, but I do have a wedding to prepare for, Paul."
[Highlight] Paul "Bball Paul" Reed throws down the alley oop

[Frank] Sixers released their players’ official measurements w/o shoes today. Some changes for players from last year. Joel Embiid: 6’11.75” —> 7’0” Danny Green: 6’6” —> 6’5.5” Tobias Harris: 6’7.5” —> 6’7” Isaiah Joe: 6’3.75” —> 6’3” Tyrese Maxey: 6’1.5” —> 6’2” Paul Reed: 6’8” —> 6’9”

[Neubeck] Paul Reed said he loves competing with Embiid and talking traѕh to him. Asked if it has ever backfired on him. “Has it? Man, every time it backfireѕ. Every time. Laѕt year, I’m not gonna ѕay he dunked on me, but he just got me out the way.”
[Highlight] Paul Reed tries to spin and falls, passes to Drummond who misses the open layup but Paul Reed saves the day with the put-back slam!
[Highlight] Paul “Bball Paul” Reed rejects Giannis at the rim and has some words for the Freak
[Highlight] BBall Paul Reed gets the block on one end, leading to a fast break Eurostep into a slam on the other as the 76ers increase their lead over Toronto!
[Highlight] Paul Reed gets the block on one end and finishes with the euro step on the other!
[Highlight] Andre Drummond shows off his passing skills with the sweet dime down low to Paul Reed
[Highlight] Paul Reed stuff Giannis at the rim and Maxey scores the transition bucket
